intro: Daucus parviflorus var. breviumbellatus, commonly known as the small-flowered carrot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
